public static void main(String[] args) {
    ThreadPoolExecutor threadPoolExecutor = new ThreadPoolExecutor(2, 200, 1, TimeUnit.DAYS, new LinkedTransferQueue<>());
    for (long i = 0; i < Long.MAX_VALUE; i++) {
        threadPoolExecutor.submit(new Runnable() {
            @Override
            public void run() {
                try {
                   MDC.put("k", Thread.currentThread().getName());
                    Thread.sleep(100);
                } catch (Exception e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
                }

            }
        });
    }
}

MDCAdapter æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªæ¥å£ï¼Œå…·ä½“çš„å®ç°å› ä¸ºè¿™æ˜¯slf4jé—¨é¢ä¸­çš„ã€‚å®ç°ä¼šæœ‰æ‰€ä¸åŒï¼Œä½†logbackç­‰ä¸»æµæ—¥å¿—å®ç°éƒ½æ˜¯newä¸€ä¸ªThreadLocalï¼Œå°†Mapå®¹å™¨ç»‘å®šåˆ°ThreadLocalä¸­ã€‚ä»£ç ç‰‡æ®µæ„Ÿå—ä¸€ä¸‹ï¼š

public class LogbackMDCAdapter implements MDCAdapter {
    final ThreadLocal<Map<String, String>> copyOnThreadLocal = new ThreadLocal();
public void put(String key, String val) throws IllegalArgumentException {
    if (key == null) {
        throw new IllegalArgumentException("key cannot be null");
    } else {
        Map<String, String> oldMap = (Map)this.copyOnThreadLocal.get();
        Integer lastOp = this.getAndSetLastOperation(1);
        if (!this.wasLastOpReadOrNull(lastOp) && oldMap != null) {
            oldMap.put(key, val);
        } else {
            Map<String, String> newMap = this.duplicateAndInsertNewMap(oldMap);
            newMap.put(key, val);
        }

    }
}

protectedÂ TransactionAttributeÂ computeTransactionAttribute(MethodÂ method,Â @NullableÂ Class<?>Â targetClass)Â {
Â Â Â Â //Â Don'tÂ allowÂ no-publicÂ methodsÂ asÂ required.
Â Â Â Â ifÂ (allowPublicMethodsOnly()Â &&Â !Modifier.isPublic(method.getModifiers()))Â {
Â Â Â Â Â Â returnÂ null;
Â Â Â Â }

Â Â Â Â //Â TheÂ methodÂ mayÂ beÂ onÂ anÂ interface,Â butÂ weÂ needÂ attributesÂ fromÂ theÂ targetÂ class.
Â Â Â Â //Â IfÂ theÂ targetÂ classÂ isÂ null,Â theÂ methodÂ willÂ beÂ unchanged.
Â Â Â Â MethodÂ specificMethodÂ =Â AopUtils.getMostSpecificMethod(method,Â targetClass);

Â Â Â Â //Â FirstÂ tryÂ isÂ theÂ methodÂ inÂ theÂ targetÂ class.
Â Â Â Â TransactionAttributeÂ txAttrÂ =Â findTransactionAttribute(specificMethod);
Â Â Â Â ifÂ (txAttrÂ !=Â null)Â {
Â Â Â Â Â Â returnÂ txAttr;
Â Â Â Â }

Â Â Â Â //Â SecondÂ tryÂ isÂ theÂ transactionÂ attributeÂ onÂ theÂ targetÂ class.
Â Â Â Â txAttrÂ =Â findTransactionAttribute(specificMethod.getDeclaringClass());
Â Â Â Â ifÂ (txAttrÂ !=Â nullÂ &&Â ClassUtils.isUserLevelMethod(method))Â {
Â Â Â Â Â Â returnÂ txAttr;
Â Â Â Â }

Â Â Â Â ifÂ (specificMethodÂ !=Â method)Â {
Â Â Â Â Â Â //Â FallbackÂ isÂ toÂ lookÂ atÂ theÂ originalÂ method.
Â Â Â Â Â Â txAttrÂ =Â findTransactionAttribute(method);
Â Â Â Â Â Â ifÂ (txAttrÂ !=Â null)Â {
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â returnÂ txAttr;
Â Â Â Â Â Â }
Â Â Â Â Â Â //Â LastÂ fallbackÂ isÂ theÂ classÂ ofÂ theÂ originalÂ method.
Â Â Â Â Â Â txAttrÂ =Â findTransactionAttribute(method.getDeclaringClass());
Â Â Â Â Â Â ifÂ (txAttrÂ !=Â nullÂ &&Â ClassUtils.isUserLevelMethod(method))Â {
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â returnÂ txAttr;
Â Â Â Â Â Â }
Â Â Â Â }
Â Â Â Â returnÂ null;
Â Â }
